chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 11:42 am.

11:29 AM Solvaline Renee Brown in Court,  Atty Philip A. Helgeson, DA Halle E. Hatch in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Hannah Olson. S/T. DA Hatch questions Officer Olson. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Helgeson.  DA Hatch is asking the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:43 PM Solvaline Renee Brown appears in Court,  DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Helgeson could not appear today. Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.  Court will reset the PH. records.addlTxt: No Contact Whatsoever with D'Angelo Isreal or Alex Jones.
DE from PCJ

3:01 PM Defendant Solvaline Renee Brown appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Derek Sanders appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $500.00 cash bond w/conditions of NC w/D'Angleo Isreasl or Alex Jones, objection. Court orders bond as requested by the State. DE does not qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. DE argues the bond. Court adjourned at 3:13 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
